description: Foundations of English as a language system: observation, description vs prescription, core analytic lenses.

topics.name: Descriptive vs Prescriptive
coreClaims: Descriptive grammar models how language is used across contexts; prescriptive rules enforce preferred norms.
Academic analysis often prioritizes description first, then evaluates appropriateness by audience/context.
skills: Explain why a form is marked/unmarked in a given context.

topics.name: Units of Analysis
coreClaims: Sound → morpheme → word → phrase → clause → sentence → discourse.
Each level has structure (form) and function (what it does).
skills: Label the level you’re analyzing before making a claim.
Avoid mixing levels (e.g., treating a discourse effect as a syntax error).

topics.name: Form–Function Reasoning
coreClaims: Good analysis links form (structure) to function (meaning/use) with evidence.
Evidence can be intuitive judgments, corpora, or usage references, depending on task.
